;工作人员周一在费城郊区加紧搜寻失踪的九个月大婴儿男孩和他两岁的妹妹在周末与家人开车去烧烤时，因周末降雨导致河岸水位上涨，被洪水冲走。

;

;上梅克菲尔德镇消防队长蒂姆·布鲁尔 (Tim Brewer) 周一表示，这将是一项“艰巨的任务”，100 名搜索人员和大量无人机将沿着流入宾夕法尼亚州巴克斯县特拉华河的小溪寻找这对兄弟姐妹。

;

;这些孩子是一个组织的成员。布鲁尔早些时候表示，南卡罗来纳州查尔斯顿的一家人在周六探亲访友时遭遇了山洪。

;

;“当他们试图逃离猛烈的洪水时，爸爸带走了他四年的孩子“我的儿子是大儿子，而母亲和祖母则抓住了另外两个孩子。”他说。

;

;父子俩“奇迹般地”得以安全抵达。布鲁尔说：“然而，祖母、母亲和两个孩子都被洪水冲走了。”上梅克菲尔德警方在社交媒体帖子中表示，祖母幸存下来。但两个孩子的母亲去世了。另外四人在洪水中丧生，但目前尚不清楚他们是谁。受害者姓名尚未公布。

;

;周一，科琳·考特尼 (Colleen Courtney) 参加了搜索现场附近的一次教堂会议，她是为遇难者家属祈祷的人之一。

;

;“这真是一场悲剧我确信，太多的悲伤，以及现在正在发生的哀悼。我祈祷能找到这些孩子。”来自新泽西州尤因的考特尼说道。

;

;暴雨和洪水淹没了美国东北部；破纪录的气温袭击南部

;

;周末的大雨导致新罕布什尔州、马萨诸塞州、康涅狄格州、纽约州和新泽西州部分地区发生山洪，本已饱和的东北部周一开始变得干燥。新泽西州州长菲尔·墨菲周日宣布进入紧急状态，并计划周一早些时候巡查该州西北部地区的受损情况。

;

;周日早上，确认龙卷风袭击了马萨诸塞州北布鲁克菲尔德，但没有发现任何迹象。据报告有人受伤或重大财产损失。在新罕布什尔州，几个城镇的一些道路塌陷，大雨将周日在新罕布什尔州赛车场举行的纳斯卡比赛推迟了一天。

;

;佛蒙特州报告称，在近一周前的历史性洪水倾倒后，没有立即出现安全威胁。两天内降雨量相当于两个月的降雨量。

;

;佛蒙特州应急管理机构报告称，暴风雨过后，急流救援队在夜间又进行了六次救援。该机构还在监测因降雨而面临山体滑坡风险的地区。

;

;预计周二会有更多降雨。

;

;周日的强风暴导致机场数百个航班取消。纽约市地区，数百人被延误。

;

;纽约州州长 Kathy Hochul 表示，长岛萨福克县两小时内降雨量达 13 厘米（5 英寸）。过去一周，该州因风暴造成了 5000 万美元的损失。

;

;在北卡罗来纳州，洪水导致一名 49 岁妇女的死亡，她的汽车被冲出亚历山大县的道路。周六深夜。与她同车的一名男子获救。

;

;“做得还不够”：韩国洪水死亡事件让人们对极端天气计划产生怀疑

;

;堪萨斯州和密苏里州数千人由于周末风暴席卷了这些州，周一停电。堪萨斯州最大的电力供应商 Evergy 表示，可能需要几天时间才能为所有客户恢复供电。

;

;这可能会给这些人带来困难，因为预计堪萨斯州和密苏里州将出现更多风暴和令人窒息的高温据国家气象局报道，本周早些时候。

;

;宾夕法尼亚州致命的山洪暴发让人想起当年艾达余波穿过新泽西州时导致至少 25 人死亡的暴雨。 2021 年。由于泥水淹没了行车车道并淹没了低洼房屋，人们将汽车遗弃在被冲刷的道路上。

;

;2018 年，宾夕法尼亚州兰开斯特县的大雨使地面厚度达到 25 厘米（10 英寸）。短时间内浇水。没有人在那次洪水中丧生。

;中美高层交往为修复两国关系奠定了基础美国企业家表示，尽管今年夏天的正式访问尚未达成表明停止紧张关系的具体协议，但新的外交可能会导致进口关税降低，并创造他们认为，这将为双方创造更友好的商业氛围。

;

;“我认为任何直接接触都比出于政治目的而向媒体发表的言论要好，”著名厨师兼四家餐厅的老板乔治·陈 (George Chen) 说。旧金山唐人街的一层餐厅综合体。

;

;“了解这一点非常重要，如果中国和美国不合作，两个超级大国都将遭受损失。”

;

;经过几个月的僵局，华盛顿和北京已恢复高层对话。美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯上周在雅加达与中国高级外交官王毅就双边、地区和全球问题进行了交谈。本月早些时候，美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦 (Janet Yellen) 访问了北京，此前布林肯于 6 月访问中国首都，与习近平主席会面。

;

;本周，美国总统乔·拜登 (Joe Biden) 的气候特使约翰·克里 (John Kerry) 抵达北京耶伦在北京就环境问题进行了会谈。

;

;耶伦表示相信，在贸易、技术转让、安全和地缘政治问题发生争端后，她的此行有助于使两国关系“站稳脚跟”。

;<总部位于科罗拉多州的材料科学公司 Cocona 的首席执行官杰夫·鲍曼 (Jeff Bowman) 表示，耶伦的访问可以在较长时期内建立关系。他的公司生产一种用于纱线的吸汗母粒添加剂，中国买家今年对此表现出了更大的兴趣。

;

;有关美国可能出台的新的对华投资禁令，您需要了解的 5 件事

;< “关系不是事件，”鲍曼说。 “这是一个长期的过程。”

;

;在中西部威斯康星州，14年的人参种植者江明涛表示，希望美国商务部长能够跟进耶伦访问，降低贸易关税。

;

; p>;

;前总统唐纳德·特朗普于 2018 年发起的美中贸易战已促使对价值 5500 亿美元的商品征收进口关税。中国的人参关税迫使江将产量减半。

;

;美国限制向中国转让先进技术，进一步加剧了两国关系的紧张，除了双方继续在人权、台湾的未来、以及南中国海的领土争端。

;

;北京方面寻求提高疫情后的经济增长率，并维持其作为投资地的全球吸引力。

;

;美国各地的零售商唐人街团结运动的联合牵头组织者布莱恩·庞 (Brian Pang) 表示，唐人街希望耶伦的访问能够改善中美关系，该运动由北美 18 个城市的华人商业中心组成。

;

;种族分歧和种族歧视的影响他说，Covid-19 伤害了企业主，并补充说，“我们都对对话中出现的地缘政治状态感到焦虑”。

;

;但两国的一些商界人士警告说，最近的高位高层访问没有达成任何具体协议。他们指出，耶伦和布林肯提到华盛顿可能对与中国军事相关的美国在华投资实施新禁令。

;

;“在中国开展业务的美国公司对高层官员已经采取行动感到高兴和松了一口气。华盛顿的顾问道格拉斯·巴里（Douglas Barry）关注中美贸易趋势，他表示：“我们又开始见面了。”

;

;“但有一种感觉，就像是在流沙上铺了木板，”巴里补充道。 “在新常态的轮廓变得清晰之前，还有许多繁重的工作要做。”

;

;新的投资限制如果生效，至少会缩小范围以适用于特定问题，而无意抛出问题。前上海美国商会会长、现任旧金山大学常驻高管克尔·吉布斯 (Ker Gibbs) 表示，“正如耶伦国务卿所说，这里面临的挑战是吉布斯说：“以确保限制措施的针对性正确，不会产生意想不到的后果。”

;

;美中深化产业联系的“宝贵机会之窗”

;

;美国国会的许多议员然而，仍然反对恢复与中国的接触。

;

;监督中国共产党的众议院委员会上周对其成员认为对美国企业有害的经济行为提出了反对，同时多项针对北京的法案已转向投票。

;

;与此同时，参议院悬而未决的《香港经济贸易办事处认证法案》可能会关闭或限制香港在华盛顿、纽约和旧金山的经济办事处，因为美国认为这些办事处是中国人。

; Tue, 18 Jul 2023 03:50:02 +0800 How will Nato’s stress on global security play out in Asia?https://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3227892/how-will-natos-stress-global-security-play-out-asia?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.18 03:30;

;北约正在从全球角度看待安全。 “安全是全球性的”是维尔纽斯北约峰会上反复重复的口号。在采用马德里战略概念（北约十年路线图）一年后，跨大西洋联盟在升级其能力以应对日益激烈的战略竞争的世界时，交付了一些关键进展和信息。

;

;首先，它有坚定不移地支持乌克兰。在维尔纽斯峰会上，各方商定了一系列承诺，以加强乌克兰在加入北约方面取得的进展。这包括一项帮助乌克兰军队过渡以达到北约运作标准的多年援助计划、建立北约-乌克兰理事会以加强政治关系以及决定放弃成员行动计划的要求，这是一条改革之路在加入该联盟之前。

;

;此外，七国集团提出与乌克兰合作制定强化安全方案。然而，加入北约并没有明确的时间表或路径，这让乌克兰领导层感到沮丧。

;

;该联盟没有在维尔纽斯做出具体承诺，而是表示将“能够向乌克兰发出邀请”。当盟友同意且条件满足时，乌克兰将加入该联盟”。这让人想起2008年布加勒斯特峰会上未能做出的承诺。尽管如此，维尔纽斯向基辅发出了积极、统一的信息，表示致力于深化关系并提供支持。

;

;其次，承诺加强北约在复杂的全球安全环境中开展行动的准备。为此，该联盟在峰会前迅速采取行动，北约秘书长延斯·斯托尔滕贝格、土耳其总统雷杰普·塔伊普·埃尔多安和瑞典首相乌尔夫·克里斯特森进行了会谈，埃尔多安承诺推动土耳其议会批准瑞典的入盟议定书。再加上芬兰最近加入北约，加强了该联盟在波罗的海地区的存在。

;

;随着近年来安全威胁和挑战发生深刻变化，北约跟进其马德里战略构想，制定了新的、全面的防御计划。这些计划强调联合采购、互操作性、指挥结构、国防投资、生产能力和工业创新。特别重要的是北约盟国做出的具体承诺，即实现至少将国内生产总值的 2% 用于国防开支。

;

;第三，北约联盟越来越多地从全球角度看待安全问题。北约印太伙伴——澳大利亚、日本、新西兰和韩国——连续第二年参加峰会，这表明欧洲-大西洋和印太安全架构之间的联系日益紧密。

;

;尽管集体防御仍然是欧洲的首要任务，但中俄轴心加上北京的力量投送能力，凸显了两个地区面临的共同安全问题以及这些合作伙伴在北约议程中的重要性。

;

;尽管进行了数月的讨论维尔纽斯公报中没有提及在日本设立北约联络处。考虑到有关该联盟在印太地区角色的争议性辩论，这并不令人意外，这些讨论在某种程度上反映了北约内部在如何最好地应对中国构成的威胁方面的分歧。然而，斯托尔滕贝格澄清说，这一选择“仍在考虑之中”，表明它尚未完全排除。

;

;虽然欧洲-大西洋和印度-太平洋地区面临着不同的挑战，但存在着天然的交叉- 北约及其伙伴在捍卫基于规则的国际秩序以及支撑其的价值观和利益方面达成区域共识。

;

;东京联络处将使日本在塑造世界秩序方面发挥独特且有影响力的作用。北约对印度-太平洋地区的看法，特别是在了解中国方面。凭借与北京的悠久接触历史，东京处于有利地位，可以为北约和欧洲大西洋共同体提供有关中国政策的更多见解和专业知识。

;

;由于北约并未登陆日本短期内，就印太战略而言，最切实的成果是与日本就未来四年的个性化伙伴关系计划达成协议。该倡议包括 16 个目标和 4 个优先事项，涵盖新出现的和长期存在的安全问题。该联盟计划与澳大利亚、新西兰和韩国开展类似的合作活动。

;

;如果这一计划成真，地区联络处的设立将象征着全球安全格局的转变。然而，布鲁塞尔安全、外交和战略中心主任路易斯·西蒙指出，这不应被误认为是北约直接负责印太地区的安全和威慑。

;

;更重要的是，一个联络处日本的北约组织将像世界其他地方的其他组织一样发挥作用，并成为促进人们了解北约及其代表的工具。它还将挑战俄罗斯和中国试图推动的联盟叙述，并将帮助北约提高对该地区安全发展的认识。这对于印度等正以前所未有的热情向西方开放的国家至关重要。

;

;考虑到乌克兰战争以及北约内部改革和其他事态发展，北约将如何发展还有待观察。马德里战略理念和联盟的全球安全观可以与其基本和地理使命相协调。

;17 岁的韩裔美国高中生朱莉娅·金 (Julia Kim) 正忙于研究大学对上个月美国最高法院关于平权行动的裁决感到不安。她担心：这会给本已不透明的招生过程增添更多混乱，使少数族裔相互对立，并有可能削弱她在白人占主导的郊区长大后所寻求的多样性。

;

;“我要去在这个过程中，你比以前更加沮丧，因为你知道自己作为亚洲人的经历不会得到应有的重视，”来自密苏里州哥伦比亚市的金说。 “禁止平权行动是不好的，它会服务于白人的利益，特别是白人至上。

;

;“我知道亚裔美国人社区中有很多说法认为平权行动伤害了我们，但我个人不同意。”

;

;6 月 29 日，法院有效终止了美国高等教育中注重种族的招生做法，颠覆了四十年的先例。六比三的裁决推翻了下级法院，裁定哈佛大学和北卡罗来纳大学实行歧视性配额制度，不公平地使学术资格较差的学生受益，而不是亚裔美国人和白人。

;

;和亚裔美国人进行评估，一些人担心结果可能没有多大帮助，甚至可能对社区不利——尽管这场运动是以他们的名义进行的。

;

;“这不是万能药，”加州大学戴维斯分校法学教授加布里埃尔·钦 (Gabriel Chin) 说道。 “这是否对亚裔美国人有帮助，我对此表示怀疑。”

;

;尽管后果还有待观察，但乔治城大学的一项研究估计，仅根据考试成绩录取会减少亚裔在顶尖大学的名额下降了一个百分点——从 11% 上升到 10%——而非裔美国人和拉丁裔的参赛人数将几乎减半，降至 11%。预计最大的赢家将是白人和富人，他们的比例将从 66% 上升至 75%。

;

;“当种族这一因素被消除时，白人学生将获得最大收益，”他说。纽约亨特学院社会学教授玛格丽特·M·钦 (Margaret M Chin)。

;

;美国最高法院坚决反对将种族作为大学录取的决定因素

;

;这一可能的结果引起了人们的担忧，即亚裔-使用了美国社区。法院审理的这两起案件是由白人保守派活动人士爱德华·布鲁姆（Edward Blum）提起的。布鲁姆此后发誓要将自己的努力扩展到就业、少数族裔合同和其他领域，但在之前的一个案件中，他试图推翻以白人妇女为原告的平权行动，但没有成功。

;

;“平权行动政策发挥了重要作用。亚裔美国人倡导基金会民间团体在一份声明中表示，“在确保亚裔美国人接受高等教育方面发挥着重要作用”。 “这些诉讼背后的白人至上主义议程利用少数反对平权行动的亚裔美国人作为其努力的棋子——将‘模范少数族裔’神话武器化，以分裂我们的社区。”

;

;一个相关的担忧是亚洲人在顶尖大学中的比例已经不成比例，如果看到他们减少其他少数族裔甚至贫穷白人在顶尖大学的名额，可能会遭到进一步的社会抵制。

;

;例如，尽管美国人口比例为 7% ，哈佛招生中亚裔已占 28%，耶鲁招生中亚裔占 21%。

;

;在此之前，受“中国病毒”影响，针对亚裔美国人的偏见和暴力急剧上升。以及前总统唐纳德·特朗普等人挥舞的“功夫流感”言论。

;

;“问题是否会从被视为需要对美国人采取平权行动转变为‘亚洲人太多’？” Gabriel Chin 问道。

;

;“一旦我们打开潘多拉魔盒，它可能会加剧亚裔仇恨和反亚裔暴力。”

;

;虽然许多亚裔家长希望最高法院的裁决能够打开更多的大门，但尽管法院基本上禁止在招生中使用种族因素，但它仍将公开种族作为其孩子进入哈佛、耶鲁大学和其他精英大学的大门，围绕这一决定的不确定性可能会持续数年。候选人在考虑申请（例如个人论文）方面的经验。但法院没有定义这些限制，尽管它警告说，这种例外不能用于维持现已非法的配额制度。

;

;制定这些限制预计将涉及广泛的诉讼。就在该决定几天后，黑人和拉丁裔团体对哈佛提起诉讼，称该大学的遗产项目偏向于以白人为主的校友的子女，也具有歧视性。

;

;另一个担忧是，这一结果可能会刺激哈佛大学的发展。美国亚裔和黑人社区之间的不和，这两个群体已经看到了自己的差异。

;

;Sunnie Liu，24 岁，艺术和历史双学位，最近从耶鲁大学毕业，是非营利性新生项目，追踪微信上的错误信息。

;

;哈佛传统招生在平权行动裁决后受到质疑

;

;虽然民意调查显示，超过一半的亚裔美国人社区支持对于平权行动，刘说，微信上的少数人——主要是第一代、上层中产阶级的中国郊区居民——表示反对。

;

;刘是来自德克萨斯州休斯顿的工人阶级中国移民的女儿，她说据《哥伦比亚新​​闻评论》数据显示，有超过 65 个右翼华裔微信账户，相比之下，有 3 个更左倾的账户，他们的声音经常被压低。

;

;“传播新闻和讨论的微信群” ，包括平权行动，成为传播右翼错误信息和论点的场所，”刘说。 “一种常见的错误叙述指责‘内城黑人和棕色人种的孩子’夺走了更应得的亚裔美国人的席位。”

;

;皮尤研究中心 (Pew Research) 在法院宣布裁决前不久发布的一项民意调查发现，在听说过平权行动的美国少数族裔群体中，53% 的人支持，五分之一的人反对。但中国人的反对最为强烈，其次是越南人和韩国人社区；印度人和菲律宾人是最支持的。

;

;法院判决的亚裔美国人支持者认为，美国不再需要针对种族群体的特殊公平条款，“功绩”应该占上风。对一些人来说，尤其令人恼火的是哈佛录取过程中的一项规定，根据诉讼，根据论文、推荐信和校友面试，亚裔美国人的性格得分较低。

;

;“我正在实现我的美国梦，因为在这个国家，你的行动决定你的成功，而不是你的种族和民族，”加利福尼亚州共和党众议员米歇尔·斯蒂尔在推特上发帖称。韩裔美国人斯蒂尔最近在一场带有种族色彩的竞选活动中击败了另一位亚裔美国候选人后赢得了选举。

;

;长期居住在布鲁克林的斯坦利·吴 (Stanley Ng) 表示，近 20 年前，他感到沮丧他发现亚裔美国学生没有资格参加帮助贫困学生进入纽约顶尖公立高中的预科课程。 2007 年，吴提起诉讼并最终获胜（在他的孩子毕业后很久），巩固了他对平权行动的反对。

;

;“是时候了，”他说。 “我们一直在等待这个。这最终成真了。”

;

;Ng 多年前认识了 Blum，当时 Blum 正在招募亚洲人参加他的诉讼，他说他不相信 Blum 会利用亚洲人作为其议程的代理人，也不知道 Blum 是否会利用亚洲人作为其议程的代理人。该裁决最终将增加亚洲人的学术录取率。

;

;“过去，由于你的姓氏和居住地，你会自动处于不利地位，”吴说。 “至少现在这种争论将会消失。”

;

;任何社区的大多数家长都希望他们的孩子进入顶尖学校，这是通向更好生活的大门。但进入哈佛大学对许多来自名牌大学相对较少的国家的第一代移民家庭产生了特别的共鸣——清华大学或北京大学、延世大学或高丽大学、印度理工学院——导致他们近乎痴迷于进入哈佛大学。很少有常春藤联盟大学在追求美国梦。

;

;与该国多元化的亚裔社区中的许多问题一样，平权行动的两极分化也往往会沿着社区的许多教育、政治和代际断层线瓦解。新移民通常认为，他们成功的最佳途径就是超越其他少数族裔。

;

;他们在美国出生的同龄人在看到亚洲人如何从 1960 年代的公民社会中获益后，往往更支持打破玻璃天花板的集体尝试。权利斗争最终废除了长期以来对华人不利的国籍配额。

;

;“主要问题是不同边缘化社区内部的分裂，”密苏里州高中生金说。 “‘模范少数民族’的神话是故意制造出来与黑人产生隔阂的。”

;

;亚洲的全有或全无考试历史悠久，可以追溯到中国隋朝的科举考试（581-公元618年），也引起了共鸣。

;

;“有趣的是，有很多亚裔美国家长，尤其是来自韩国、中国、日本的亚裔家长，他们不喜欢一考制在他们自己的国家，谈论那是多么残酷。现在建议测试应该是一切，这是非常不幸的，”公民组织亚裔美国人促进正义的主席兼执行董事约翰·杨说。

;

;杨还表示考虑到美国有大量优秀学校可供选择，单一关注哈佛大学、耶鲁大学、斯坦福大学、麻省理工学院和其他一些学校有点狭隘。

;

;对于刚从耶鲁大学毕业的刘来说，长期当时的亚裔美国人也因未能更好地理解新移民的观点、解决他们的担忧以及弥合平权行动和其他有争议问题上的社区分歧而承担责任。

;

;平权行动的支持者补充说，它已成为对于几乎所有申请者来说，这个招生系统令人沮丧、高风险、令人焦虑，而且往往是零和游戏。

;

;只有 3.4% 的候选人被哈佛大学录取，4.35% 的候选人被耶鲁大学录取——其中许多人更多的名额通常保留给运动员、传统候选人和院长名单上的人，而受到的关注要少得多。

;

;“平权行动的作用很小，”杨说。 “有人建议，如果你取消招生的某一方面，那么这一方面就会惩罚亚裔美国人。”

;

;曾在该校招生委员会任职的加布里埃尔·钦 (Gabriel Chin) 补充道：“有些人肯定是种族主义者。我希望亚裔美国人不会发现自己与那群人打交道。”

; Tue, 18 Jul 2023 02:20:02 +0800 Flailing DeSantis would do better focusing on climate change than targeting Trumphttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3227971/flailing-desantis-would-do-better-focusing-climate-change-targeting-trump?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.18 01:00;
;;

;上周美国政治最重大的事态发展之一引起了人们的关注有关环境和商业方面的新闻，这些因素的综合作用对共和党的两位主要总统候选人来说变得越来越不方便。

;

;他们都集中在佛罗里达州或包括佛罗里达州这一事实是考虑到它是最容易受到与气候变化相关的极端天气影响的国家之一，这也不是偶然的。

;

;这三项进展中的第一个进展是前总统唐纳德·特朗普最亲近的人的支持率明显下滑明年白宫选举的竞争对手是佛罗里达州州长罗恩·德桑蒂斯。对德桑蒂斯输给领先特朗普的解释包括，他回避那些不崇拜他的媒体，以及他的形象与俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京一样热情。

;

;还有一个共和党温和派人士对德桑蒂斯竞选团队最近投放的一则极其奇怪的广告表示强烈反对。它的主角是肌肉发达、方下巴有男子气概的男人 - 具有讽刺意味的是，他的目的是为了提升他作为最反 LGBTQ 候选人的信誉。

;

;这一集揭示了州长无法从与迪士尼的持续战争中吸取教训 - 这使得他成为最反 LGBTQ 候选人的候选人。是佛罗里达州最大的雇主之一 - 反对该州的“不要说同性恋”法。它在温和派中也没有得到很好的支持，他们想知道为什么德桑蒂斯没有看到他有更大的鱼要煎。

;

;煎鱼的主题给我们带来了第二个发展。德桑蒂斯州周围海洋珊瑚礁的水温达到了现代测量中未见的水平，国家海洋和大气管理局监测到某些地区的水温高达 97 华氏度（36.1 摄氏度）。

;

;该事件与此同时，佛罗里达州最大的奥基乔比湖正在酝酿一场有毒藻类大量繁殖的灾难。由于降雨量高于平均水平，该湖有可能溢出到居民区，而降雨量本身就是气候变化的结果。

;

;还有第三个因素。随着湖泊水位上涨和飓风季节临近，许多佛罗里达人会发现抵御气候变化带来的灾难的选择越来越少。这是因为 Farmers Insurance 宣布将停止在佛罗里达州销售其自有品牌的房屋保险、汽车保险和雨伞保险，这些保险占其在该州销售的保单的近三分之一。

;

;DeSantis 和他的选民基础 –与共和党的很大一部分人一起——可能被右翼错误信息所蒙蔽，认为气候变化是一个骗局，因此能够忽视科学家几十年来一直警告我们的所有证据。然而，保险业并不是进步激进主义的堡垒。

;

;如果保险精算专家没有警告说，最近佛罗里达州和美国其他地区的一系列恶劣天气，保险公司就不会放弃业务。美国是我们未来的常态。 As State Farm showed us by pulling its business from California, this withdrawal is becoming an industry-wide trend.

;

;While many in DeSantis' base might be able to ignore the fury of young people demanding immediate action to cut the burning of fossil fuels, few of them want to face the heightened risk of paying higher insurance premiums or zero compensation when the next hurricane rips the roof off their homes.

;

;And while Trump – who showed his scorn for the environment by pulling the US out of the Paris climate agreement in 2017 – might be able to skate to the Republican nomination next year, he will face a similar set of circumstances shaped by fire, floods, drought and extreme heat.

;

;DeSantis no match for Trump in race for Republican presidential nomination

;

;In large swathes of the country, particularly in the South, summer is becoming an indoor season. Try blaming that on US President Joe Biden, who has made efforts to fight climate change a top priority.

;

;Whether Trump prevails in the primaries or DeSantis manages to regain the momentum he had after his decisive win during last year's midterm election, they will have to work hard to distract those in their base from the inescapable conclusion that climate change has made wildfires more intense, more common, larger and more costly.

;

;In the face of these factors, perhaps DeSantis could propose his own solutions for the steaming seas that surround him and his state instead of cavorting with studs in his campaign ads.

;

;

; Tue, 18 Jul 2023 01:20:02 +0800 Crimea bridge attack: Russia tells stranded tourists to drive home via occupied Ukrainehttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/russia-central-asia/article/3228039/crimea-bridge-attack-russia-tells-stranded-tourists-drive-home-occupied-ukraine?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.18 01:09;
;;

;Russian officials on Monday encouraged holidaymakers stranded in Crimea to drive home through occupied Ukraine after a Ukrainian attack halted car traffic on the bridge linking the peninsula to Russia.

;

;The attack killed two people and left their daughter injured, with President Vladimir Putin ordering authorities to repair the road and help tourists stranded in Crimea.

;

;Commercial flights to Moscow-annexed Crimea have been suspended after the start of the offensive in Ukraine, and most Russian tourists usually drive to Crimea over the bridge.

;

;With traffic jams building up, officials suggested tourists drive 400km (250 miles) through territories held by the Russian army, some of which are seriously affected by fighting.

;

;“I ask residents and guests of the peninsula to refrain from travel on the Crimea bridge and with the aim of safety choose an alternative overland route through the new regions,” said the Moscow-installed head of Crimea, Sergei Aksyonov.

;

;Russian state television aired a map of the route, which goes through occupied Melitopol to the port of Mariupol and ends in the southern Russian city of Rostov. It reminded people to take their passports with them.

;

;Officials in occupied Ukraine said they would reduce curfew times to let tourists through and that the Russian army would increase security.

;

;“Safety is ensured by the Russian army, it will be strengthened,” said Vladimir Saldo, the Russian-installed head of the section of Ukraine's southern Kherson region that is controlled by Moscow.

;

;Putin says Russia has 'sufficient stockpile' of cluster bombs and will use them if necessary

;

;He said he had “minimised” the curfew to “let the transit transport through”. Saldo warned that there would be checkpoints that are in place to avoid “sabotage” but that formalities will be “reduced”.

;

;The RIA Novosti news agency reported that there were some 50,000 tourists holidaying in Crimea and that most had come by car. The broadcaster published a video of cars lining up from Crimea to the occupied Kherson region for several kilometres.

;

;In the neighbouring southeastern region of Zaporizhzhia, which is heavily targeted by Kyiv's counteroffensive, the Moscow-installed governor Yevgeny Balitsky said officials will keep the route “safe”.

;

;“Road traffic will be in place with maximum convenience for our citizens through the new region,” Balitsky said.

;

;Crimean officials assured drivers that the route was reliable.

;

;“It is a famous route.非常好的一个，沿着亚速海，风景优美，”克里米亚议会主席弗拉基米尔·康斯坦丁诺夫说道。 “We don't see anything worrying.”

;

;Russian television aired footage of some of the queues, with some motorists determined to get home no matter what.

;

;“They told us: go! Everything will be fine, with God,” one man told state television.

;

;But others seemed more hesitant.

;

;Russian tourist deported from Bali over nude photo on sacred tree

;

;“We are thinking about what to do,” one woman told the same state television channel. “To go back on holiday or go to Melitopol?”

;

;Melitopol fell to Russian forces early in their offensive last year and has been regularly targeted by attacks.

;

;Crimea's transport ministry published a checklist of what tourists should be aware of before the journey.

;

;“Give way to army vehicles and columns,” read one of the instructions.

;

;It also recommended that travellers bring cash with them and warned of police and military checkpoints along the way.

; Tue, 18 Jul 2023 01:20:02 +0800 From GDP to youth unemployment, 6 takeaways from China’s economic data in Junehttps://www.scmp.com/economy/economic-indicators/article/3228016/gdp-youth-unemployment-6-takeaways-chinas-economic-data-june?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.18 00:00;
;;

;

;

;China's economy grew by 6.3 per cent in the second quarter of 2023, year on year, up from the 4.5 per cent growth seen in the first quarter, but below the 6.8 per cent predicted by Chinese data provider Wind.

;

;But quarter on quarter, China's gross domestic product (GDP) rose by only 0.8 per cent, slowing from a rise of 2.2 per cent in the first quarter.

;

;In the first half of the year, China's GDP grew by 5.5 per cent compared to the same period last year, higher than Beijing's full-year growth target for 2023.

;

;“China's second quarter GDP growth surprised on the downside.显然，未来几天我们可能不得不接受新一波的增长前景下调。 However, the 5 per cent growth target looks very attainable,” said Zhou Hao, chief economist at Guotai Junan International.

;

;Harry Murphy Cruise, an economist at Moody's Analytics, said the quarter-on-quarter growth rate was a “worrying result for an economy that's struggling to gain momentum”.

;

;“China's recovery is going from bad to worse. 6 月季度同比增长 6.3% 低于预期，并因去年遭受封锁蹂躏的参考期而感到受宠若惊。 After a sugar injection in the opening months of 2023, the pandemic hangover is plaguing China's recovery,” he added.

;

;

;

;The jobless rate for the 16-24 age group hit a new high of 21.3 per cent in June, up from 20.8 per cent in May.

;

;The overall urban surveyed jobless rate remained unchanged at 5.2 per cent last month.

;

;The record high youth unemployment “is only adding to concerns”, added Cruise at Moody's Analytics.

;

;“Though there are structural factors behind it, the elevated youth unemployment rate highlights the need for more policy support to broaden out domestic demand and bring back high quality jobs,” said economists at HSBC.

;

;

;

;Retail sales rose by 3.1 per cent in June from a year ago, down from 12.7 per cent growth in May.

;

;The fall was mainly driven by slower growth in coronavirus -sensitive restaurant sales and also and auto sales due to a high base related to the release of pent-up demand after Shanghai came out of lockdowns in June 2022, said analysts at Goldman Sachs.

;

;“Households are wary of spending. Consumers remain sceptical about the recovery, and expectations relating to employment and income gains have turned negative,” added Cruise at Moody's Analytics.

;

;

;

;Industrial production, a gauge of activity in the manufacturing, mining and utilities sectors, grew by 4.4 per cent last month, year on year, up from an increase of 3.5 per cent in May.

;

;The growth rose against market expectations, although automobile production growth plunged on a high base, said analysts at Goldman Sachs.

;

;By industry segments, manufacturing growth rose to 4.8 per cent year on year, utilities by 4.9 per cent and mining by 1.5 per cent.

;

;China eyes Asean trade ties, but members fear falling into 'geopolitical trap'

;

;But Lloyd Chan, senior economist at Oxford Economics, said the recent uptick in industrial production is only set to be temporary due to a challenging external environment for China's exports, which fell by 12.4 per cent in June compared to a year earlier.

;

;“We retain our cautious outlook for both industrial production and exports in the coming months, as destocking pressures will continue to rise. Moreover, trade frictions with the US are also increasing,” he said.

;

;

;

;Fixed-asset investment – a conventional tool for Beijing to drive up growth – rose by 3.8 per cent in the first six months of 2023, year on year, down from a rise of 4 per cent in the first five months of the year.

;

;The improvement was largely state-led, according to Chan at Oxford Economics, as it helped offset a fall of 0.2 per cent from a year earlier in the January-June period in private investment.

;

;Property investment, which often accounts for one third of the total investment, also fell by 7.9 per cent in the first half of the year.

;

;“Clearly, there remains a significant lack of property investment appetite, and the continued double-digit decline in housing starts bodes poorly for the sector,” said Chan.

;

;

;

;Analysts at Goldman Sachs expect more targeted easing measures in coming months to counteract persistent growth headwinds, including the property slowdown and low market confidence, although they added the magnitude of stimulus should be smaller than in previous easing cycles.

;

;“With the fragile recovery waning, stimulus is being injected.中国人民银行降低了一些主要贷款利率，同时延长了电动汽车销售的减税政策。 But more is desperately needed,” added Cruise at Moody's Analytics.

;

;“We expect to see monetary policy ease in coming months and targeted fiscal supports given to key industries, including real estate and construction.但额外的支持并不是灵丹妙药。 Increasingly, 2023 is looking like a year to forget for China.”

;

;On Monday, the People's Bank of China (PBOC) kept the rate on the one-year medium-term lending facility (MLF) loans to financial institutions at 2.65 per cent following last month's cut from 2.75 per cent.

;

;“Given the current state of the Chinese economy, the PBOC's cutting cycle is set to continue. We expect another 10 basis point policy rate cut in the next month or two,” said Larry Hu, chief China economist at Macquarie Group.

;

;Hu also expects a cut to the reserve requirement ratio soon “in order to encourage banks to provide more credit to the real economy”.

;

;Zhou Hao, chief economist at Guotai Junan International, did point to more positive news in the activity data for June as industrial production grew well above the market consensus, while fixed-asset investment gain also beat expectations.

;

;“Certainly, this is a consumption-induced slowdown, which calls for policy support on the demand side. We believe further rate cuts are more or less warranted, and see the MLF rates will be lowered by another 10 basis as soon as the third quarter,” he said.

;

;“The rate cuts will translate into reduction of mortgage payments, which will not only help the property buyers, but also help the consumers to improve their spending power.”

; Tue, 18 Jul 2023 00:20:02 +0800 Women, girls tell of horrific, traumatic rape, sexual assault in Sudan as conflict rageshttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/africa/article/3228038/women-girls-tell-horrific-traumatic-rape-sexual-assault-sudan-conflict-rages?utm_source=rss_feed

;;

;On May 9, soon after her 12th birthday, Muna left her home in Khartoum and walked to the local shop.她经常独自跑腿，很快就会回到母亲身边。但这次不是。两名买烟的士兵注意到穆娜正在挑选面包，其中一人抓住了她的手臂，另一人则举起了步枪，威胁店主与其保持距离。 They dragged her to a construction site nearby and raped her.

;

;The soldiers were members of the Rapid Support Forces, a paramilitary group that's been fighting the Sudanese Army for control of the capital city for the past three months. Both have a fearsome reputation.

;

;Dumped on the side of the road, bleeding and in pain, Muna made it home with the help of the shopkeeper, a family friend.她的父母向司法当局提出投诉，司法当局将他们转介给一位心理学家，而心理学家则建议他们避开最近的医院，因为该医院由无国界医生组织控制。 Instead, they checked Muna for sexually-transmitted infections at a private clinic and asked a pharmacy for sanitary pads and painkillers.

;

;Days later, the family fled the city.在消失之前，穆娜的父母允许分享她的故事，但为了她的安全，她的真实姓名没有被使用。她的强奸行为——政府文件披露并得到两名援助人员证实——是苏丹冲突中士兵实施性暴力的更广泛模式的一部分。 Many cases are going unreported, activists say, in a country where foreign journalists are essentially banned by the government.

;

;ICC investigates killings in Sudan's Darfur as UN reports mass grave

;

;Fighting erupted in April when the two generals who'd been ruling Sudan since an October coup began arguing over an internationally backed plan to transition to democracy. As clashes rumble on out of the media spotlight, neighbours – Chad, the Central African Republic, Egypt, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Libya and South Sudan – as well as the US and Saudi Arabia are trying to broker peace to avoid a full-blown civil war that spills across borders.

;

;More than 2.9 million people have left their homes since the conflict began, with almost 700,000 of them seeking refuge in the region.根据美国研究组织武装冲突地点和事件数据项目的数据，约有 3,000 人被杀。 Both the RSF and the Sudanese Army are accused of abuses, including sexual violence against women and girls like Muna.

;

;The UN Human Rights Office in Sudan said it has received credible reports of 21 incidents of conflict-related sexual violence against at least 57 women and girls. Sulima Ishaq, director of the government's Unit for Combating Violence against Women under the Ministry of Social Development, says her team has recorded 88 incidents – 42 in Khartoum and the rest in the Darfur region, a scene of ethnically-motivated attacks.

;

;Those cases account for only a tiny fraction of the total, according to Ishaq, who documented Muna's assault. “这些数字并不代表真正发生的事情”，她说。 In the largely conservative country where most positions of power are held by men “there is a lot of stigma around sexual violence, and it all goes under-reported”.

;

;At least 22 civilians killed in air strikes near Khartoum, Sudan

;

;Health workers and activists say the vast majority of girls and women coming forward with allegations of abuse point the finger at the RSF.该准军事组织的发言人否认了所谓的毫无根据的指控，并补充说“无国界医生组织强烈谴责一切形式的不道德行为，并断然拒绝对我们部队的指控。” A spokesperson for the Sudanese army did not respond to questions.

;

;One of the worst documented cases so far in the conflict took place on May 1 when RSF soldiers abducted 25 women – aged between 14 and 56 – travelling from Nyala, in the Darfur region, to a camp for the internally displaced.根据伊沙克所在单位撰写的一份事件报告，他们被带到一家酒店，在那里多次遭到强奸。 Seven refused medical help, either because they feared being stigmatised or because of the trauma they endured, according to Ishaq.

;

;Rape and sexual assault during war are aimed at humiliating a community as well as the individual into total submission, and both are considered war crimes and a breach of international humanitarian law.

;

;In Sudan, such acts are also being committed by fighters to try to pressure civilians to leave their homes, which they take over and use as safe houses or to position snipers, according to Enas Muzamil, a women's rights activist who works with victims of sexual assault across Sudan. “Militia members commit these crimes in Khartoum and Darfur, in addition to looting, occupying homes and expelling their residents,” she said.

;

;In peacetime, doctors and health workers would help victims of sexual violence, but their numbers are dwindling. At least 27 have been killed by gunfire or shelling since fighting began, according to the Preliminary Committee of Sudanese Doctors, an association documenting deceased medical staff.

;

;At least three doctors have been abducted during the same period, either for their links to pro-democracy resistance groups or to care for injured combatants, according to Abdul Mounem, a senior member of Sudan's Central Committee of Sudanese Doctors. Since most medical supplies are distributed to civilians through the Ministry of Health, the RSF is also looting and commandeering hospitals, he said.

;

;Sudan war displaces over 2 million as fighting rages in Darfur

;

;That leaves few options.苏丹档案组织负责人马哈辛·达哈卜 (Mahasin Dahab) 表示，无数妇女和女孩正在转向社交媒体，该组织利用开源情报来记录侵犯人权行为。 She said online activists have referred some sexual assault cases to NGOs on the ground.

;

;Sexual assault by both the RSF and the army is the result of historic impunity, according to Dahab. “The laws don't support our claims of gender-based violence”, she said, adding that before war the police violated women's bodies but now, “the RSF uses gender-based violence as a weapon of war”.

; Mon, 17 Jul 2023 23:50:02 +0800 Record 16 PLA warships sailed close to Taiwan in single day, island’s defence ministry sayshttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/military/article/3228029/record-16-pla-warships-sailed-close-taiwan-single-day-islands-defence-ministry-says?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.17 23:00;
;;

;Beijing sent a record number of warships close to Taiwan within a single day last week, surpassing a previous high set during then US House speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taipei last year.

;

;People's Liberation Army warships made 16 trips near Taiwan in the 24 hours before 6am on Saturday, the island's defence ministry said, despite no announcement of any major drills nearby.

;

;That topped the 14 warships sent towards Taiwan as Beijing, which considers Taiwan to be a breakaway province, reacted to Pelosi's visit in August with days of unprecedented live-fire drills around the island.

;

;In April, it sent as many as 12 warships in a day as part of another large-scale exercise after Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen met Pelosi's successor Kevin McCarthy in California.

;

;US Navy patrol plane flies over Taiwan Strait amid increased PLA activity

;

;Beijing has sent fighter jets and warships to Taiwan's self-declared air defence identification zone (ADIZ) almost every day in recent years, as relations worsened under Tsai's independence-leaning Democratic Progressive Party (DPP).

;

;Those trips only intensified after Pelosi's visit, with PLA jets more willing to fly across the median line of the Taiwan Strait, a tacit boundary that both sides generally abided by for decades until 2019. Beijing no longer recognises the line.

;

;The increased military pressure also comes with Taiwan preparing for presidential elections in January, when Tsai reaches her mandated two-term limit.

;

;Latest opinion polls show DPP candidate William Lai Ching-te to be the front runner, with Hou Yu-ih of the Beijing-friendly Kuomintang – Taiwan's main opposition party – placing third, behind Ko Wen-je of the relatively new Taiwan People's Party.

;

;Last week also saw an uptick in PLA forays around Taiwan, with dozens of planes sent each day, according to the defence ministry in Taipei.

;

;PLA planes including bombers, drones, and the advanced Su-30 and J-16 fighter jets made 32 flights in the 24 hours before 6am on Wednesday.

;

;Some of them flew from the southwest of Taiwan to its south, while others crossed the strait median line. This was followed by 33 flights on Thursday and 30 on Friday, along similar routes.

;

;“ROC Armed Forces have monitored the situation and tasked [combat air patrol] aircraft, navy vessels and land-based missile systems to respond to these activities,” Taiwan's defence ministry said in a daily statement announcing the incursions, using the initialism of Taiwan's official name, the Republic of China.

;

;The number of flights dropped to 15 on Saturday, 10 on Sunday and 11 on Monday. No PLA plane had crossed the median line or entered the southwestern sector of the Taiwanese ADIZ since Sunday, the ministry said.

;

;Neither the defence ministry in Beijing nor the PLA announced any heightened military activity near Taiwan.

;

;The flights and warship passages reflected the PLA's plans to normalise drills around Taiwan, former PLA instructor Song Zhongping said.

;

;Such acts are considered politically provocative and are Beijing's form of protest against closer engagement between Taipei and other governments, especially Washington.

;

;Beijing is opposed to Taipei having official exchanges with other governments, and views such interaction as a challenge to its sovereignty.

;

;While the US is Taiwan's biggest informal ally, it – like most countries – does not regard the self-ruled island as independent. However, it is opposed to any forcible change to the status quo, which Beijing has not ruled out.

;

;Song said one cause for the stepped-up exercises could be recent actions by the US-led West, including a Nato communique on Wednesday describing China as coercive and a challenge to the defence alliance's interests, security and values.

;

;“Announcing military exercises is not always necessary,” Song said.

;

;Song also cited the latest US arms sales to Taiwan and a closer US-Japan-South Korea alliance as reasons for tension, even though the recent visit by Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has raised hopes of a revival in US-China economic dialogue.

;

;US defence act 'vital' to security of Taiwan, President Tsai Ing-wen says

;

;Collin Koh, a senior fellow at the S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies in Singapore, said the surge in PLA activities could perhaps be linked to Washington's 2024 National Defence Authorisation Act, which passed in the US House of Representatives on Friday with provisions calling for military cooperation with Taiwan.

;

;Projecting power with more ships near Taiwan as opposed to planes allowed the PLA to focus on overstretching the resources of the island's navy, Koh said.

;

;“The PLA has been … using the frequent fly-bys as a way to gradually erode the ROC Air Force capacity,” he said.

;

;Deadly military plane crashes in recent years revealed how overstretched Taiwanese air force had become, Koh said, adding that the island also had to spend more of its defence budget on overheads and maintenance because of PLA activities.

;

;“If you are a PLA planner, wouldn't it look pretty logical that the next frontier to stress [out] the Taiwanese military is the naval side?”

;President Emmanuel Macron travels to the southwest Pacific next week offering a “French alternative” to a region marked by rising China-US tensions, his office said on Monday.

;

;Macron's trip starts in New Caledonia, a French overseas territory that is bitterly divided after three successive referendums rejected independence from France.

;

;He is then to travel on to Vanuatu and Papua New Guinea, an “historic” part of the journey because no French president had ever visited non-French islands in the region, an official said.

;

;Macron will use those two stops to outline his Indo-Pacific strategy, aimed at “recommitting” France to the region, the official said.

;

;Macron last year relaunched France's Indo-Pacific approach in the aftermath of a bitter row over a cancelled submarine contract with Australia, casting France as a balancing power in a region dominated by the tussle between China and the United States.

;

;“We don't believe in hegemony, we don't believe in confrontation, we believe in stability,” Macron said on the margins of an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (Apec) summit in November.

;

;India's Modi awarded top honour by France's Macron

;

;France's vocal engagement in the region came after Australia's then-prime minister Scott Morrison in 2021 cancelled a French contract to provide Canberra with submarines, and instead announced a deal to buy US or British nuclear-powered subs.

;

;“What we are offering is an alternative” amid the China-US stand-off, the Elysee official said. This would involve an increase in France's engagement, notably in terms of development aid and help with natural disasters.

;

;Macron's visit to New Caledonia comes five years after his last trip there, and 19 months after the New Caledonians rejected independence in a third and final referendum under the so-called Noumea accords about the island group's future.

;

;Macron at the time hailed the vote's outcome, saying “France is more beautiful” with the Pacific islands included.

;

;But he also opened the door to “a period of transition”. The island group and the government in Paris now had to build “a common project”, he said, “free from the binary choice of 'Yes' or 'No'.

;

;Pro-independence campaigners had boycotted the vote, having demanded a postponement because “a fair campaign” was impossible with high coronavirus infection numbers.

;

;The vote outcome has stoked ethnic tensions, with the poorer indigenous Kanak community generally favouring independence over the wealthier white community.

;

;“At this point, it is important for the President to invite the whole range of political representation in New Caledonia to talk with him about the future status of New Caledonia, and ongoing negotiations,” the Elysee official said.

;

;Macron will also travel to New Caledonia's east coast to draw attention to coastal erosion there.
